title: Resource Type Schema
description: Standardized enumeration of resources used by organizations in The Shadow Team Chronicles universe.

descriptions.description: Detailed explanations of each resource type (not part of the enum, provided for documentation)

financial_capital.description: Monetary resources including currency, investments, credit lines, and financial instruments.

raw_materials.description: Unprocessed natural resources that serve as inputs for production or construction.

manufactured_goods.description: Finished products ready for use or consumption.

technological_equipment.description: Specialized devices, machinery, or systems that perform specific functions.

data.description: Collected information, statistics, or digital content that can be analyzed or leveraged.

intelligence.description: Valuable information about entities, events, or developments, often obtained covertly.

personnel.description: Human workforce including employees, members, agents, or contractors.

facilities.description: Buildings or installations that house operations, production, or administrative functions.

land.description: Owned or controlled territory, real estate, or property.

energy.description: Power resources including electricity, fuel, or alternative power sources.

food_supplies.description: Nutritional resources including agricultural products, processed foods, or emergency rations.

water_sources.description: Access to clean water, including natural sources, purification capabilities, or distribution systems.

military_hardware.description: Weapons, armor, vehicles, or other equipment designed for combat or security operations.

transportation_assets.description: Vehicles, vessels, aircraft, or other means of moving people and goods.

intellectual_property.description: Patents, copyrights, trade secrets, or other legally protected ideas or creations.

specialized_knowledge.description: Expertise, skills, or technical know-how possessed by personnel.

digital_systems.description: Computer networks, software, algorithms, or other information technology resources.

propaganda_channels.description: Media outlets, communication platforms, or distribution networks for spreading messages.

historical_artifacts.description: Objects of cultural, scientific, or symbolic significance from the past.

political_connections.description: Relationships with government officials, policymakers, or influential leaders.

legal_authority.description: Official rights, permissions, licenses, or jurisdiction granted by governing bodies.

public_goodwill.description: Positive reputation, trust, or favorable perception among the general population.

espionage_network.description: Spies, informants, surveillance systems, or other covert intelligence-gathering assets.

magical_components.description: Materials, artifacts, or substances with supernatural properties used in arcane practices.

ancient_relics.description: Objects of great age with historical, mystical, or technological significance.

experimental_technology.description: Innovative devices, systems, or techniques not yet widely available or understood.

medical_supplies.description: Pharmaceuticals, equipment, facilities, or personnel related to healthcare.

communication_infrastructure.description: Systems for transmitting information, including physical networks, wireless technologies, or specialized equipment.

luxury_goods.description: High-value items that confer status, comfort, or exclusivity but are not essential for operations.

categoryMapping.description: Grouping of resource types by category (not part of the enum, provided for documentation)

tangible.description: Physical resources that can be handled, counted, or moved.

intangible.description: Non-physical resources that provide value through information, relationships, or rights.

operational.description: Resources directly involved in carrying out the organization's activities.
